(44) 171stConclusions,Minute I.)V TheWar Cabinet considered the latest developments in theGreek and Polish situations.As regards Greece, the Prime Minister and the Secretary ofState for Foreign Affairs informed the War Cabinet of- the resultsof the talk which they had had the previous night with the king of Greece, who had now agreed- to issue a declaration -appointingArchbishop Damaskinos to be Regent. It was hoped that arrange-ments could-be made for this declaration to be published in Athensthat afternoon.A full record of the discussion is contained in the Secretary'standard File of War Cabinet Conclusions.Reuters' 2. Attention was drawn to a very damaging and one-sided\ Service. report of the state of public opinion in this country about events in greece sent by Reuters' Agency to Athens. Large numbers of thereport had been circulated to our troops in Athens.The view was expressed in discussion that it was intolerablethat an Agency, which received a considerable subsidy from HisMajesty's Government, should issue messages of this description.The War Cabinet invited the Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs to enquire into the matter, and report to the War cabinet at their meeting on Tuesday, the 2nd January, indicating what action could be taken to deal with the situation.Offices of the War Cabinet, S.W. 1,30^ December, 1944.
